channel.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
channel.description:
On an early episode of Bootstrapped there was a discussion of movies that Andrey watches while coding. Many of them I've seen but this weekend I came across a list of some newer stuff about half of it I've never heard of. So I thought I'd share.
http://www.zilo.me/2013/07/06/11-must-watch-documentaries-for-entrepreneurs/
FWIW, they link to the different video sources you can find these, and The Startup Kids says it's only on iTunes, but I found it on Amazon Prime. It also has the founder of one of the startups I was in, Loic LeMeur of Seesmic.
UPDATE: I went back and looked up the podcast episode, it was episode 5. They are all linked in the show notes: http://bootstrapped.fm/bootstrapped-episode-5-lets-all-go-to-the-movies/

item.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: anon3850446
item.description:
That movie came out at the worst possible time ever – right around 9/11. I totally related to the plight of the 2 characters as I was going through a similar thing myself up north in Montreal. The good news is that their friendship endured and they went on to create other successful businesses together. Friendship over money – always…

Read full topic

item.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
I liked Startup.com, even though they failed. Dot-com excess, irrational exuberance, and a cautionary tale of what business can do to friendship.

If you are too young to remember the dot-com madness, you’ll be asking yourself WTF quite often.

Read full topic

item.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: jeremy
item.description:
I watched an amazing one last night. “Inventing David Geffen” Holy cow! This guy is amazing. I knew his name but had no idea of his story.

http://amzn.to/1cL7JGL

He grew up in Brooklyn and is now worth $6 billion. Just like @andrey.

Read full topic

item.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: ian
item.description:
Ah nice, I’ll definitely be checking some of these out. Maybe me and @andrey should pick one and talk about it on the show.

Read full topic

item.title: Movies for Entrepreneurs
item.dc:creator: jeremy
item.description:
On an early episode of Bootstrapped there was a discussion of movies that Andrey watches while coding. Many of them I’ve seen but this weekend I came across a list of some newer stuff about half of it I’ve never heard of. So I thought I’d share.

Zilo.Me – 7 Jul 13

11 Must Watch Documentaries for Entrepreneurs - Zilo.Me

Need a little inspiration? A new way of looking at things? A breath of fresh air? Advice? Guidance? Any one of these 11 films will do the trick. In no particular order (because they are all brilliant.) Candyman – The David Kline Story Candyman is the...

FWIW, they link to the different video sources you can find these, and The Startup Kids says it’s only on iTunes, but I found it on Amazon Prime. It also has the founder of one of the startups I was in, Loic LeMeur of Seesmic.

UPDATE: I went back and looked up the podcast episode, it was episode 5. They are all linked in the show notes: http://bootstrapped.fm/bootstrapped-episode-5-lets-all-go-to-the-movies/
